title.narrative: Vocational education and training linked to the needs of the private sector project

description.narrative: - Training of better quality and better adapted to the needs of the private sector - 30 projects to strengthen vocational training centres implemented benefitting 3000 students - At least 90 companies strengthen the qualification of 2800 staff members which contributes to developing the companies - 300 young vulnerable young women graduate thanks to a scholarship - Dialogue and partnerships between the private sector and training institutions

The Royal Danish Embassy (ARD) in Mali is initiating this pilot project (2021-2023) in the field of vocational education and training. The key focus of the project will be to establish a challenge fund. Through funding allocated via the challenge fund, the training and education offer will be improved, and students will obtain the qualifications required by companies. Organisations eligible for funding will be primarily vocational training institutions and formal sector companies. A complementary initiative will facilitate the access of young vulnerable women to quality training in promising trades. The project intervention area is Bamako and its surroundings, where the most important part of the formal sector companies are concentrated.
To strengthen inclusive economic growth stimulated by private sector to increase incomes and jobs/self-employment.
